Key Arguments: The bill infringes on basic human rights of freedom of speech and expression.
Individuals are capable of critically analyzing information without government intervention.
The bill is ambiguous regarding the development and enforcement of misinformation codes.
The penalties are excessive and could criminalize lawful expression.
The bill grants too much power to ACMA without sufficient checks and balances.
Notable Quotes: As an Australian citizen I do not need ACMA to ‘protect’ me, I am quite capable of choosing what information I read or watch and critically analyse ideas for myself.
Reading through this bill I find it inconsistent with basic human rights of freedom of speech and expression.
This Bill has the potential to turn law abiding Australian citizens into criminals for expressing their democratic rights to free speech and expression.
